com.simsilica.es.base

Class DefaultEntitySet

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractSet<Entity>
        • com.simsilica.es.base.DefaultEntitySet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EntitySet, java.lang.Iterable<Entity>, java.util.Collection<Entity>, java.util.Set<Entity>

    public class DefaultEntitySet
extends java.util.AbstractSet<Entity>
implements EntitySet
    A set of entities that possess certain components with automatic updates as the entity components change.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  DefaultEntitySet.RemovedComponent
      A special entity component that is used during transaction processing to temporarily mark a component as "removed".
      protected class  DefaultEntitySet.Transaction
      Keeps accumulated data about a set of changes.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      Constant used during transaction processing to mark removed components in already loaded entities.
      protected DefaultEntitySet.Transaction transaction

    • Field Detail

      • REMOVED_COMPONENT

        protected static final DefaultEntitySet.RemovedComponent REMOVED_COMPONENT
        Constant used during transaction processing to mark removed components in already loaded entities. This distinguishes them from components that have yet to be filled in and prevents the values from being re-retrieved during transaction finalization.

      • transaction

        protected DefaultEntitySet.Transaction transaction

      • getMainFilter

        protected ComponentFilter getMainFilter()

      • loadEntities

        protected void loadEntities(boolean reload)
        Called to have the entity set load its initial set of data. This is called during creation (but not construction) and when the filter is reset.

      • purgeEntities

        protected void purgeEntities()
        Removes entities from the set that no longer match the set's criteria. This will update the removedEntities tracking.

      • resetFilter

        public void resetFilter(ComponentFilter filter)
        Swaps out the current main filter for a new one. Returns true if the entity set was changed during this process. This is similar to applyChanges() and any current pending changes will be applied during the filter transition.
        Specified by:
        resetFilter in interface EntitySet

      • clearChangeSets

        public void clearChangeSets()
        Description copied from interface: EntitySet
        Clears all pending change sets accumulated during the last applyChanges(). The change sets are automatically cleared at the beginning of the next applyChanges() but sometimes it can be useful to free them early (if the change set is large, etc.).
        Specified by:
        clearChangeSets in interface EntitySet

      • hasChanges

        Description copied from interface: EntitySet

        Specified by:
        applyChanges in interface EntitySet

      • applyChanges

        @Deprecated
public boolean applyChanges(java.util.Set<EntityChange> updates)
        Deprecated. 
        Applies any accumulated changes to this list's entities since the last time it was called and returns true if there were changes. Changes that caused an update (not an add or a remove) will be added to the supplied updates set.
        Specified by:
        applyChanges in interface EntitySet
